intro: Argostemma connatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features slender, branched stems and opposite, elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five petals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
